sentence.Network_en: All the big game congregate here, and birdlife is particularly prolific.
sentence.Network_cn: 所有的大型野兽都聚集在这里，鸟类尤其丰富。

sentence.Network_en: Young people often congregate in the main square in the evenings.
sentence.Network_cn: 年轻人傍晚时经常聚集在大广场上。

sentence.Network_en: Father Illtyd kept open house and the boys would congregate in his study during their recreation time, playing cards or games.
sentence.Network_cn: 伊尔蒂德神父总是敞开大门欢迎来客，男孩子们会在娱乐时间聚在他的书房里打扑克或玩游戏。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin congregat- 'collected (into a flock), united', from the verb congregare, from con- 'together' + gregare (from grex, greg- 'a flock')

entry.def: When people congregate, they gather together and form a group.

example.ex: Youngsters love to congregate here in the evenings outside cinemas showing American films...
example.tran: 晚上，年轻人喜欢聚集在放映美国电影的电影院外面。

example.ex: Visitors congregated on Sunday afternoons to view public exhibitions.
example.tran: 每周日下午，游客成群结队地来看公开展览。

means.word_mean: 1. come together, usually for a purpose;

sentences.sentence: "The crowds congregated in front of the Vatican on Christmas Eve"

means.word_mean: 1. brought together into a group or crowd;

stems_affixes.word_buile: g增加+greg群体+ate……的→adj.合计的, 集合的
con一起+greg集合+ate……的→集合到一起→聚集的
e出+greg群体+ious……的→除了一般的团体→过分的
ag加强+greg群体+ation表名词→n.聚集,总合

stems_affixes.value_cn: 分离,隔离;种族差别待遇
stems_affixes.word_buile: segregate[v.隔离]+ion表名词→n.分离,隔离;种族差别待遇
dis分开+aggregate聚合→聚合的东西分开
se分开+greg群+ate使……→使……和人群分开→隔离

sentences.en: The crowds congregated in the town square to hear the mayor speak.
sentences.cn: 人群聚集到市镇广场上来听市长讲话。

jushi.chinese: 在暴风雨中，牲口聚集在一起。
